channel.title: NPC Spawning
channel.description: I am coding dungeoneering as some people know, and I just wanna know, when you kill an NPC, how could it stay dead, until the floor is restarded?

item.title: NPC Spawning
item.dc:creator: @stooks stooks
item.description:
@stooks wrote:

Also, my doors are screwed up, I have tried to add them into my dungeoneering, and many people have teamviewed me and said it’s done all right, they are just not placing on the server, you can’t see them…

//Dungeoneering Start c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(1762, 2463, 4783, 1, 10); c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(194, 2423, 3525, 0, 10); //Dungeoneering Rock c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(16081, 1879, 4620, 0, 10); //dung floor 6 portalEND c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(6552, 1859, 4617, 1, 10); //dung floor 6 portalEND c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(1747, 1919, 4640, 0, 10); //escape ladder c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(1747, 3048, 5233, 0, 10); item.title: NPC Spawning
item.dc:creator: @stooks stooks
item.description:
@stooks wrote:

Haha, thanks :). Will do, I haven’t even been coding that long, I just take snippets, use common sense, and apply it…works so far, I pick up new things as I go along :).

Read full topic

item.title: NPC Spawning
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Either change the respawn time to be extremely long (and then create a method that loads up the dung NPCs upon a new floor/restart). You’ll probably have to load them into a seperate file though.

Or create a method that checks if an NPC is first spawned in the dung area, and then another to reload the spawns upon a new game.

Good luck. Think logic.

Read full topic
